channel.title: Impact on Braxton Wolfes Sports Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Impact on Braxton Wolfes Sports Blog

item.title: Victor Wembanyama's Defensive Pace Versus Legends And Current Trajectory
item.description:
# Defensive Legends Comparison - First 127 Games
library(tidyverse)

## Warning: package 'lubridate' was built under R version 4.3.3

## ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
## ✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
## ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
## ✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
## ✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
## ✔ purrr     1.0.2     
## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
## ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
## ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(gt)

# Read data files from Documents
wemby <- read_csv("/Users/braxtonwolfe/Documents/WembyAdvanced")

## Rows: 5 Columns: 29
## ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Delimiter: ","
## chr  (6): Season, Age, Team, Lg, Pos, Awards
## dbl (23): G, GS, MP, PER, TS%, 3PAr, FTr, ORB%, DRB%, TRB%, AST%, STL%, BLK%...
## 
## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
## ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

duncan <- read_csv("/Users/braxtonwolfe/Documents/TDAdvanced")

## Rows: 21 Columns: 29
## ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Delimiter: ","
## chr  (6): Season, Age, Team, Lg, Pos, Awards
## dbl (23): G, GS, MP, PER, TS%, 3PAr, FTr, ORB%, DRB%, TRB%, AST%, STL%, BLK%...
## 
## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
## ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

hakeem <- read_csv("/Users/braxtonwolfe/Documents/HakeemAdvanced")

## Rows: 23 Columns: 29
## ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Delimiter: ","
## chr  (6): Season, Age, Team, Lg, Pos, Awards
## dbl (23): G, GS, MP, PER, TS%, 3PAr, FTr, ORB%, DRB%, TRB%, AST%, STL%, BLK%...
## 
## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
## ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

dwight <- read_csv("/Users/braxtonwolfe/Documents/DHAdvanced")

## Rows: 20 Columns: 29
## ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Delimiter: ","
## chr  (6): Season, Age, Team, Lg, Pos, Awards
## dbl (23): G, GS, MP, PER, TS%, 3PAr, FTr, ORB%, DRB%, TRB%, AST%, STL%, BLK%...
## 
## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
## ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

ad <- read_csv("/Users/braxtonwolfe/Documents/ADAdvanced")

## Rows: 22 Columns: 29
## ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Delimiter: ","
## chr  (6): Season, Age, Team, Lg, Pos, Awards
## dbl (23): G, GS, MP, PER, TS%, 3PAr, FTr, ORB%, DRB%, TRB%, AST%, STL%, BLK%...
## 
## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
## ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

# Function to get first 127 games stats
get_stats <- function(df, name, debut_year) {
  df <- df %>%
    filter(!str_detect(Season, "Yrs|Avg")) %>%
    mutate(G = as.numeric(G), DWS = as.numeric(DWS), 
           `BLK%` = as.numeric(`BLK%`), DBPM = as.numeric(DBPM),
           `DRB%` = as.numeric(`DRB%`), MP = as.numeric(MP)) %>%
    arrange(Season) %>%
    mutate(cum_games = cumsum(G))
  
  df_127 <- df %>% filter(cum_games <= 127 | lag(cum_games, default = 0) < 127)
  
  tibble(
    Player = name,
    Era = debut_year,
    DWS = round(sum(df_127$DWS, na.rm = TRUE), 1),
    `BLK%` = round(weighted.mean(df_127$`BLK%`, df_127$MP, na.rm = TRUE), 1),
    `DRB%` = round(weighted.mean(df_127$`DRB%`, df_127$MP, na.rm = TRUE), 1),
    DBPM = round(weighted.mean(df_127$DBPM, df_127$MP, na.rm = TRUE), 1)
  )
}

# Get all stats with debut years
all_stats <- bind_rows(
  get_stats(wemby, "Victor Wembanyama", "2023-24"),
  get_stats(duncan, "Tim Duncan", "1997-98"),
  get_stats(hakeem, "Hakeem Olajuwon", "1984-85"),
  get_stats(dwight, "Dwight Howard", "2004-05"),
  get_stats(ad, "Anthony Davis", "2012-13")
)

# Find max values
max_dws <- max(all_stats$DWS)
max_blk <- max(all_stats$`BLK%`)
max_drb <- max(all_stats$`DRB%`)
max_dbpm <- max(all_stats$DBPM)

# Add categories led column
all_stats <- all_stats %>%
  mutate(
    `Categories Led` = (DWS == max_dws) + (`BLK%` == max_blk) + 
                       (`DRB%` == max_drb) + (DBPM == max_dbpm)
  ) %>%
  arrange(desc(`Categories Led`), desc(DWS))

print(all_stats)

## # A tibble: 5 × 7
##   Player            Era       DWS `BLK%` `DRB%`  DBPM `Categories Led`
##   <chr>             <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>            <int>
## 1 Victor Wembanyama 2023-24   8.2   10.2   30.8   3.2                3
## 2 Tim Duncan        1997-98  11.9    4.5   23.2   1.9                1
## 3 Hakeem Olajuwon   1984-85   9.1    4.7   20.1   0.8                0
## 4 Dwight Howard     2004-05   7.9    3.3   25.9  -0.1                0
## 5 Anthony Davis     2012-13   5.6    6     23.4   0.8                0

# Create enhanced table
table <- all_stats %>%
  gt() %>%
  tab_header(
    title = md("**Defensive Legends: First 127 Games**"),
    subtitle = "Victor Wembanyama vs All-Time Great Defenders"
  ) %>%
  # Add column spanner for defensive metrics
  tab_spanner(
    label = "Defensive Metrics",
    columns = c(DWS, `BLK%`, `DRB%`, DBPM)
  ) %>%
  # Column labels with explanations
  cols_label(
    Era = "First 127 Games",
    DWS = "DWS",
    `BLK%` = "BLK%",
    `DRB%` = "DRB%",
    DBPM = "DBPM",
    `Categories Led` = "Categories Led"
  ) %>%
  # Highlight ONLY Wembanyama's Player and Era columns in gray
  tab_style(
    style = cell_fill(color = "#C4CED4"),
    locations = cells_body(
      columns = c(Player, Era), 
      rows = Player == "Victor Wembanyama"
    )
  ) %>%
  # Bold Wembanyama's name
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(weight = "bold"),
    locations = cells_body(columns = Player, rows = Player == "Victor Wembanyama")
  ) %>%
  # Highlight max DWS
  tab_style(
    style = cell_fill(color = "#90EE90"),
    locations = cells_body(columns = DWS, rows = DWS == max_dws)
  ) %>%
  # Highlight max BLK%
  tab_style(
    style = cell_fill(color = "#90EE90"),
    locations = cells_body(columns = `BLK%`, rows = `BLK%` == max_blk)
  ) %>%
  # Highlight max DRB%
  tab_style(
    style = cell_fill(color = "#90EE90"),
    locations = cells_body(columns = `DRB%`, rows = `DRB%` == max_drb)
  ) %>%
  # Highlight max DBPM
  tab_style(
    style = cell_fill(color = "#90EE90"),
    locations = cells_body(columns = DBPM, rows = DBPM == max_dbpm)
  ) %>%
  # Highlight Categories Led column for anyone with 2+
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "#FFD700"),
      cell_text(weight = "bold")
    ),
    locations = cells_body(columns = `Categories Led`, rows = `Categories Led` >= 2)
  ) %>%
  # Center align numeric columns
  cols_align(
    align = "center",
    columns = c(Era, DWS, `BLK%`, `DRB%`, DBPM, `Categories Led`)
  ) %>%
  # Add footnotes
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = "Data from Basketball-Reference.com | First 127 career games"
  ) %>%
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = "Green = Best in category | Gold = 2+ categories led"
  ) %>%
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = "DWS = Defensive Win Shares | BLK% = Block % | DRB% = Defensive Rebound % | DBPM = Defensive Box Plus/Minus"
  ) %>%
  # Styling options
  tab_options(
    heading.title.font.size = 24,
    heading.subtitle.font.size = 14,
    table.font.size = 12,
    column_labels.font.weight = "bold"
  )

# Save and display
gtsave(table, "/Users/braxtonwolfe/Documents/defensive_legends.png")
table
Defensive Legends: First 127 Games
Victor Wembanyama vs All-Time Great Defenders
Player First 127 Games Defensive Metrics Categories Led
DWS BLK% DRB% DBPM
Victor Wembanyama 2023-24 8.2 10.2 30.8 3.2 3
Tim Duncan 1997-98 11.9 4.5 23.2 1.9 1
Hakeem Olajuwon 1984-85 9.1 4.7 20.1 0.8 0
Dwight Howard 2004-05 7.9 3.3 25.9 -0.1 0
Anthony Davis 2012-13 5.6 6.0 23.4 0.8 0
Data from Basketball-Reference.com | First 127 career games
Green = Best in category | Gold = 2+ categories led
DWS = Defensive Win Shares | BLK% = Block % | DRB% = Defensive Rebound % | DBPM = Defensive Box Plus/Minus 
# Victor Wembanyama Defensive Impact Scatterplot - FLIPPED VERSION
# Traditional scatterplot: Team Rank vs. Defensive Rating (2024-25 Season)

library(tidyverse)

# Read data files from Documents
team_ratings <- read_csv("/Users/braxtonwolfe/Documents/TeamDefensiveRatings.csv", skip = 1)

## Rows: 30 Columns: 15
## ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Delimiter: ","
## chr  (3): Team, Conf, Div
## dbl (12): Rk, W, L, W/L%, MOV, ORtg, DRtg, NRtg, MOV/A, ORtg/A, DRtg/A, NRtg/A
## 
## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
## ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

wemby_onoff <- read_delim("/Users/braxtonwolfe/Documents/WembyOnOffRatings.csv", delim = "\t")

## New names:
## Rows: 3 Columns: 30
## ── Column specification
## ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "\t" chr
## (3): Split, Tm, MP dbl (27): eFG%...4, ORB%...5, DRB%...6, TRB%...7, AST%...8,
## STL%...9, BLK%.....
## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
## Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
## • `eFG%` -> `eFG%...4`
## • `ORB%` -> `ORB%...5`
## • `DRB%` -> `DRB%...6`
## • `TRB%` -> `TRB%...7`
## • `AST%` -> `AST%...8`
## • `STL%` -> `STL%...9`
## • `BLK%` -> `BLK%...10`
## • `TOV%` -> `TOV%...11`
## • `eFG%` -> `eFG%...13`
## • `ORB%` -> `ORB%...14`
## • `DRB%` -> `DRB%...15`
## • `TRB%` -> `TRB%...16`
## • `AST%` -> `AST%...17`
## • `STL%` -> `STL%...18`
## • `BLK%` -> `BLK%...19`
## • `TOV%` -> `TOV%...20`
## • `eFG%` -> `eFG%...22`
## • `ORB%` -> `ORB%...23`
## • `DRB%` -> `DRB%...24`
## • `TRB%` -> `TRB%...25`
## • `AST%` -> `AST%...26`
## • `STL%` -> `STL%...27`
## • `BLK%` -> `BLK%...28`
## • `TOV%` -> `TOV%...29`

# Clean team ratings data
nba_teams <- team_ratings %>%
  select(Team, DRtg) %>%
  filter(!is.na(Team), !is.na(DRtg)) %>%
  mutate(DRtg = as.numeric(DRtg))

# Extract Wembanyama on/off court defensive ratings
wemby_on <- wemby_onoff %>% filter(Split == "On Court") %>% pull(DFrg) %>% as.numeric()
wemby_off <- wemby_onoff %>% filter(Split == "Off Court") %>% pull(DFrg) %>% as.numeric()

# Remove Spurs from NBA teams and rank all teams
nba_teams_only <- nba_teams %>%
  filter(Team != "San Antonio Spurs") %>%
  arrange(DRtg) %>%
  mutate(rank = row_number())

# Calculate where Spurs would rank with/without Wemby
all_drtgs <- c(nba_teams_only$DRtg, wemby_on, wemby_off)
wemby_on_rank <- sum(all_drtgs < wemby_on) + 1
wemby_off_rank <- sum(all_drtgs < wemby_off) + 1

# Create Spurs data
spurs_data <- tibble(
  Team = c("Spurs WITH Wembanyama", "Spurs WITHOUT Wembanyama"),
  DRtg = c(wemby_on, wemby_off),
  rank = c(wemby_on_rank, wemby_off_rank),
  Type = c("With Wemby", "Without Wemby")
)

# Add type to NBA teams
nba_teams_only <- nba_teams_only %>%
  mutate(Type = "NBA Teams")

# Combine for plotting
plot_data <- bind_rows(
  nba_teams_only %>% select(Team, DRtg, rank, Type),
  spurs_data
)

# Print summary
cat("\n=== WEMBANYAMA DEFENSIVE IMPACT ===\n\n")

## 
## === WEMBANYAMA DEFENSIVE IMPACT ===

cat(sprintf("Spurs WITH Wembanyama: %.1f DRtg (Rank: #%d)\n", wemby_on, wemby_on_rank))

## Spurs WITH Wembanyama: 112.7 DRtg (Rank: #9)

cat(sprintf("Spurs WITHOUT Wembanyama: %.1f DRtg (Rank: #%d)\n", wemby_off, wemby_off_rank))

## Spurs WITHOUT Wembanyama: 120.5 DRtg (Rank: #30)

cat(sprintf("IMPACT: %d positions | %.1f point difference\n\n", 
            wemby_off_rank - wemby_on_rank, wemby_off - wemby_on))

## IMPACT: 21 positions | 7.8 point difference

# Create FLIPPED scatterplot
ggplot(plot_data, aes(x = rank, y = DRtg)) +
  # Grid and theme first
  theme_minimal(base_size = 13) +
  # Elite defense zone (now TOP-RIGHT)
  annotate("rect", xmin = 0, xmax = 10.5, ymin = 105, ymax = 113, 
           fill = "#90EE90", alpha = 0.08) +
  # Bottom tier zone (now BOTTOM-LEFT)
  annotate("rect", xmin = 25, xmax = 32, ymin = 117, ymax = 123, 
           fill = "#FFB6C1", alpha = 0.08) +
  # NBA teams - all same size
  geom_point(data = filter(plot_data, Type == "NBA Teams"),
             size = 4, color = "gray40", alpha = 0.7) +
  # Spurs WITH Wemby - green (will be TOP-RIGHT)
  geom_point(data = filter(plot_data, Type == "With Wemby"),
             size = 4, color = "#2ca02c") +
  # Spurs WITHOUT Wemby - red (will be BOTTOM-LEFT)
  geom_point(data = filter(plot_data, Type == "Without Wemby"),
             size = 4, color = "#d62728") +
  # Arrow connecting the two Spurs points
  geom_segment(data = spurs_data,
               aes(x = spurs_data$rank[1], xend = spurs_data$rank[2],
                   y = spurs_data$DRtg[1], yend = spurs_data$DRtg[2]),
               arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.3, "cm"), type = "closed"),
               linewidth = 1.5, color = "#C4CED4", alpha = 0.7) +
  # Key/legend in open space - adjusted for flipped chart
  annotate("text", x = 20, y = 121, 
           label = "WITH Wembanyama", 
           hjust = 0, size = 3.5, fontface = "bold", color = "#2ca02c") +
  annotate("text", x = 20, y = 119.5, 
           label = "WITHOUT Wembanyama", 
           hjust = 0, size = 3.5, fontface = "bold", color = "#d62728") +
  annotate("text", x = 20, y = 118, 
           label = "Other NBA Teams", 
           hjust = 0, size = 3.5, fontface = "bold", color = "gray40") +
  # Styling
  labs(
    title = "Victor Wembanyama's Defensive Impact",
    subtitle = "2024-25 NBA Season: Defensive Rating by Team Rank",
    x = "Team Defensive Rank (30 = Worst Defense, 1 = Best Defense)",
    y = "Defensive Rating (Points Allowed per 100 Possessions)",
    caption = "Lower defensive rating is better (top of chart) | Data: Basketball Reference"
  ) +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5, margin = margin(b = 5)),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 11, hjust = 0.5, margin = margin(b = 15)),
    plot.caption = element_text(size = 9, hjust = 0.5, margin = margin(t = 10), color = "gray40"),
    axis.title.x = element_text(size = 11, face = "bold", margin = margin(t = 10)),
    axis.title.y = element_text(size = 10, face = "bold", margin = margin(r = 4)),
    axis.text = element_text(size = 10),
    panel.grid.major = element_line(color = "gray85", linewidth = 0.5),
    panel.grid.minor = element_line(color = "gray92", linewidth = 0.3),
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA),
    plot.margin = margin(20, 20, 20, 20)
  ) +
  # FLIPPED SCALES - reversed directions
  scale_x_reverse(breaks = seq(30, 0, -5), limits = c(32, -1)) +
  scale_y_reverse(breaks = seq(122, 106, -2), limits = c(123, 106))

## Warning: Use of `spurs_data$rank` is discouraged.
## ℹ Use `rank` instead.

## Warning: Use of `spurs_data$DRtg` is discouraged.
## ℹ Use `DRtg` instead.

## Warning: Use of `spurs_data$rank` is discouraged.
## ℹ Use `rank` instead.

## Warning: Use of `spurs_data$DRtg` is discouraged.
## ℹ Use `DRtg` instead.

## Warning in geom_segment(data = spurs_data, aes(x = spurs_data$rank[1], xend = spurs_data$rank[2], : All aesthetics have length 1, but the data has 2 rows.
## ℹ Please consider using `annotate()` or provide this layer with data containing
##   a single row.

## Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
## (`geom_rect()`).

# Save the plot
ggsave("/Users/braxtonwolfe/Documents/wembanyama_defensive_impact.png", 
       width = 13, height = 8, dpi = 300, bg = "white")

## Warning: Use of `spurs_data$rank` is discouraged.
## ℹ Use `rank` instead.

## Warning: Use of `spurs_data$DRtg` is discouraged.
## ℹ Use `DRtg` instead.

## Warning: Use of `spurs_data$rank` is discouraged.
## ℹ Use `rank` instead.

## Warning: Use of `spurs_data$DRtg` is discouraged.
## ℹ Use `DRtg` instead.

## Warning in geom_segment(data = spurs_data, aes(x = spurs_data$rank[1], xend = spurs_data$rank[2], : All aesthetics have length 1, but the data has 2 rows.
## ℹ Please consider using `annotate()` or provide this layer with data containing
##   a single row.

## Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
## (`geom_rect()`).

cat("\n✓ FLIPPED scatterplot saved: wembanyama_defensive_impact.png\n")

## 
## ✓ FLIPPED scatterplot saved: wembanyama_defensive_impact.png

cat("Green dot (WITH Wemby) now in TOP-RIGHT = Elite!\n")

## Green dot (WITH Wemby) now in TOP-RIGHT = Elite!

cat("Red dot (WITHOUT Wemby) now in BOTTOM-LEFT = Poor!\n")

## Red dot (WITHOUT Wemby) now in BOTTOM-LEFT = Poor!
